text: ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS QUESTION BY PRIVATE NOTICE: Confusion over Groundwater in Chunnakam UPLIFTMENT OF SCHOOLS IN THE NORTHERN PROVINCE: Statement by Minister of Education ALLEGATION AGAINST MINISTER AND THE POLICE: Statement by Minister of Public Order and Christian Religious Affairs PERSONAL EXPLANATION BY HON. MAHINDANANDA ALUTHGAMAGE

PRIVATE MEMBERS MOTIONS: Training workers required for the Job Market - Debate Adjourned AL-JAMIATHUL GHAWSIYYAH (INCORPORATION) BILL: Read a Second time, and allocated to Standing Committee B CHAMPIKA PREMADASA COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT FOUNDATION (INCORPORATION) BILL: Read a Second time, and allocated to Standing Committee B CHAMBER OF CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRY OF SRI LANKA (INCORPORATION) BILL: Read a Second time, and allocated to Standing Committee B
The Parliament met at 1.30 p.m., MR. DEPUTY SPEAKER [THE HON. CHANDIMA WEERAKKODY] in the Chair. PETITIONS
. Petitions ordered to be referred to the Committee on Public Petitions.
NORTH WESTERN PROVINCIAL MINISTRY OF HEALTH : MONEY ALLOCATED
asked the Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine:
(i) the amount of money allocated for the Provincial Ministry of Health by the North Western Provincial Council for the year 2012;
(ii) the services provided by the hospitals using that money; and
(iii) the amount of money spent by the North Western Provincial Council per patient who obtained treatments during the aforesaid year?
(b) Will he table separately, the number of patients who got treatments from the hospitals in the North Western Province in the year 2012?

: : CONSTRUCTION OF POWER PLANT IN ANGUNAKOLAPELASSA AREA: DETAILS
asked the Minister of Power and Energy:
(i) plans have been prepared to construct a power plant bordering the villages of Debokkawa, Suriyapokuna and Koragahawala in the Angunakolapelassa area;
(ii) the fuel to be used is coal, diesel or another type; and
(iii) this project belongs to the government or the private sector?
(i) the extent of land required for the construction of the said power plant;
(ii) whether the said land has been acquired by now; (iii) whether plans have been made to grant relief to the people who will be deprived of their land and property as a result of this project; and
(iv) if so, what those relief measures are?
(i) whether tenders have been called for this project; and
(ii) whether he will table the name, address, telephone numbers, the value of tender and name of the country in the case of a foreign company of each company which submitted tenders?
(d) Will he also inform this House -
(i) the name, address, telephone number of the company which obtained the tender and the country to which it belongs; and (ii) the reasons for awarding this tender to the said company?
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Palitha Range Bandara - State Minister of Power and Energy) , 10 . . . . . . . ( ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana) , . ? ? , .

SLTB DEPOT MANAGERS : REMOVA L FROM SERVICE 5915/15 5.
asked the Minister of Internal Transport:

(i) Mr. Vijith Dharmasena, Depot Manager of the Sri Lanka Transport Boards Trincomalee Depot, who worked to enhance its income through an excellent administration, has been verbally abused with filthy words and chased away from his place of work; and
(ii) this verbal abuse and chasing away have been exerted for political reasons by the intervention of a Minister whose portfolio does not encompass the subject of transport?
(b) Will he advise the House on -
(i) whether justice will be accorded to the Depot Manager so affected by holding a Ministry level inquiry with regard to the incident referred to above;

(ii) the number of Sri Lanka Transport Board Depot Managers who have been kept away from their places of work through acts of coercion, intimidation or other methods and later removed from their posts treating them to have vacated posts;
(iii) their names, addresses and telephone numbers and the depots in which they had been serving; and
(iv) the steps that have been taken already with regard to these callous acts of injustice and those to be taken in future?

: : STUDENTS REGISTERED FOR EXTERNAL DEGREES : DETAILS
() , ? asked the Minister of Higher Education and Research:

(i) the number of students registered for external degrees from the year 2011 up to now; (ii) the number of students enroll for external degrees per year; and (iii) whether enrollments for external degrees have been stopped by now?
(i) the registration fee charged for external degrees; and
(ii) whether it has been planned to increase the registration fee?

asked the Minister of Higher Education and Research:
(i) the number of internal lecturers serving in State universities in Sri Lanka;
(ii) the number of visiting lecturers serving in the aforesaid universities; and
(iii) separately, the total amount of money spent for an internal and a visiting lecturer per month by the Government? (b) If not, why?
3. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Ajith Mannapperuma) - (2) : () (i) 2013 / 2014 60 ; (ii) , ; (iii) ; (iv) , ; ?
asked the Minister of Higher Education and Research:
(i) whether the Ministry of Higher Education has entered into agreements with any institution to construct 60 hostels for university students in the years 2013/2014;
(ii) if so, the institutions with which agreements have been entered into in relation to those constructions;
(iii) whether the accepted tender procedure was followed in selecting the construction institutions; and
(iv) if not, the factors that formed the basis for the selection of those institutions?
(i) the number of hostels assigned to each of the above institutions for construction and the sum of money agreed upon in relation to those constructions, separately;
(ii) the dates, each agreed party is due to complete the construction of hostels;
(iii) the number of students that can be accommodated in each of the hostels so constructed; and
(iv) the sum of money spent by the Ministry of Higher Education on the construction of each such hostel?
. . Question ordered to stand down. : : CAFETERIA OF FORT RAILWAY STATION : TENDER PROCEDURE 5574/14
8. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Ajith Mannapperuma) - (1):
asked the Minister of Internal Transport:
(i) whether tenders were called as regards operating the main cafeteria of the Fort Railway Station for the year 2013;
(ii) if so, the tenderers who submitted tenders;
(iii) separately, the quotations submitted by each tenderer;
(iv) the tenderer who was selected for the relevant purpose from among the above tenderers; and
(v) the basis on which such selection was made?
(i) the person who run the said cafeteria as of now; and (ii) the basis on which the said person was granted opportunity to run the said cafeteria?
: : FACULTY OF ARTS OF COLOMBO UNIVERSITY : VACANCIES
9. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Mohamed Aslam) - (1):
asked the Minister of Higher Education and Research:

(a) Is he aware that vacancies do exist in the posts of lecturer, clerk and clerical assistant at the Department of Arabic and Islamic Civilization, which was started within the Faculty of Arts of the University of Colombo in the year 1995?
(b) If so, will he inform this House whether steps will be taken to fill all those vacancies?
QUESTION BY PRIVATE NOTICE CONFUSION OVER GROUNDWATER IN CHUNNAKAM

( , ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem - Minister of Urban Development, Water Supply and Drainage) Mr. Deputy Speaker, the Hon. Member gave notice of this Question yesterday and the reply is as follows: ( ) (The Hon. Douglas Devananda) ; , ! ( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) Well, I know. I have the questions; the first question is regarding the waste oil. The Answer is: 1) I. Yes, for the details, refer to the attached Report, which I table* as Annex 1, but I will read the synopsis of it. Pattern of oil spreading showed towards northern side up to 2 kilometres from Power Station area. Based on the following analyses done by the National Water Supply and Drainage Board: * Totally, 150 wells were analysed.

* 109 (73 per cent) wells have shown the higher oil level than the standard while 07 (4 per cent) wells were under the limit and 34 wells (23 per cent) were not contaminated with oil and grease. * The oil and grease contamination was observed within 1.5 kilometres of the surrounding of the power station.

* As per the map which I table* as Annex 2 (contamination in the area as at 13th August, 2014), the high oil and grease concentration layers were observed in the surroundings of the Chunnakam Power Station area.
* Oil spreading pattern was observed towards the North, up to 1.50 to 2.0 kilometres. Oil
contaminants were spread further in the North compared to the other direction which have a spread of less than 1.5 kilometres.

The second question is regarding the Cabinet Appointed Committee. II. Yes. But the report is still in the process of final preparation by the Cabinet Appointed Committee. III. Continuous water supply is provided to the affected areas. There are six bowsers provided for this area to supply 225,000 litres per day by the National Water Supply and Drainage Board and the Pradeshiya Sabha since the Cabinet Decisions made on 17th December, 2014 and 11th February, 2015. So, the people are getting water for their drinking purposes free of charge, which is delivered to Chunnakam and Tellippalai areas. If the affected people have made a request, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board we will provide the necessary water. The National Water Supply and Drainage Board is planning for a major water scheme and funds are to be allocated. Groundwater of Chunnakam area is subjected to pollution due to agricultural activities, fertilizer used, over extraction of water and the National Water Supply and Drainage Board had to shut down the scheme in June 2012 due to the oil contamination. Then, Question No. 2 is about the Task Force appointed by the Northern Provincial Council. 2. (i) Yes, a Task Force for clean water was formed by the Northern Provincial Council in order to mitigate the problem with several objectives. The first and foremost is to ensure that the people from affected area get drinking water, which is being carried out effectively. The Regional Manager of the National Water Supply and Drainage Board, Jaffna, is one of the active members of the Task Force. During the formation of the Task Force by the Northern Provincial Council in January 2015, it was Regional Manager, National Water Supply and Drainage Board, Jaffna, who got involved with them and the National Water Supply and Drainage Board allowed him to work as per the Cabinet Decisions made on 17th December, 2014 and 11th February, 2015. The Cabinet Decision clearly informed that they should work with the local authority. The second one is to find out the extent of the oil polluted area and the toxic substances in the affected wells. In order to achieve this, an expert committee was formed with the local experts by the Provincial Council, without the participation of the National Water Supply

and Drainage Board. The appointment of the expert committee was not communicated to the Ministry of Water Supply and Drainage or the National Water Supply and Drainage Board regarding the appointed Task Force meeting. But, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board and other water-related Government institutions were not included in the expert committee. (ii) It was officially not communicated to the National Water Supply and Drainage Board or the Ministry of Water Supply and Drainage. However, as it was published in the local media, we were aware through the preliminary information of the expert committee. (iii) The National Water Supply and Drainage Board did a study from November 2013 to October 2014 and the expert committees study was carried out in the recent past. Until the final report released by B.M.U.D. Basnayaka-headed committee and NPC-appointed committee are published, we are not in a position to comment about it. (iv) Through the Media Regional Manager of the National Water Supply and Drainage Board of Jaffna. (v) Once both reports are released, a detailed study is needed for the confirmation. Our regional laboratory is closely engaged in discussing with the public. In addition to this, I would like say that there was a meeting summoned by the Hon. Prime Minister at 11 oclock in Parliament today. This morning, there was a meeting. I was also not aware that it was related to this matter. There, we pointed out that the ADB-funded Desalination Project presently does not cover the Chunnakam area, and if we are to extend the scope of that project to the Chunnakam area, since contamination of water is now observed - ( ) (The Hon. Douglas Devananda) Desalination ? ?
( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) No, it is near the - ! I do not know the place exactly.
( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) No. They will draw seawater -
( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) Those are matters that you can -

- There are two methods that have been applied. The methodology adopted by this expert committee appointed by the Provincial Council is called BTEX methodology. Our measurement is based on the hydrocarbon method. The National Water Supply and Drainage Board has found clear traces of oil and grease. [Interruption.] Yes, that is right. Our Report - ( ) (The Hon. Douglas Devananda) ? ( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) Our position is that there is contamination. People cannot drink this water. ( ) (The Hon. Douglas Devananda) They cannot drink? ( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) Yes. Therefore, -
( ) (The Hon. Douglas Devananda) ! - ( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) ?
( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) ; . . , ! . . . 500 . 500 External Resources Department - ERD - -
( ) (The Hon. Douglas Devananda) ? ? ? ( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) ! .
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) This is getting converted to a debate. Please give a direct answer, Hon. Minister. ( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) , . , 500 . . . , - CEB - . . .
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) This matter should be referred to the Consultative Committee.
( ) (The Hon. Douglas Devananda) ? ( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) . ( ) (The Hon. Douglas Devananda) .
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) Yes, Hon. Murugesu Chandrakumar, what you have got to say?
( ) (The Hon. Murugesu Chandrakumar) Hon. Minister, I would like to ask - . . , ; . . , , ?
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) Hon. Minister, please reply in short.
( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem) Okay, Mr. Deputy Speaker. If I may answer in short, . , ; . , ; . ; .
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) Thank you very much. You can take it up at the Consultative Committee.

, . . Question put, and agreed to. II

( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Sir, I move, "That notwithstanding the provisions of Standing Order No. 7 the hours of sitting on Monday 20th April, 2015 shall be 9.30 a.m. to 7.30 p.m. At 7.30 p.m. Mr. Speaker shall adjourn the Parliament without question put."
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Sir, I move, "That this Parliament at its rising this day do adjourn until 9.30 a.m. on Monday, April 20th, 2015."
